page.title: 01COMMONSIDE
page.content: THE BLOCK ENTITLED COMMONSIDE LIES IN TEVIOTDALE, PART OF THE SCOTTISH BORDERS. IT IS A RURAL AREA WITH ROLLING HILLS WHICH ARE FARMED EXTENSIVELY. THE RIVER TEVIOT WINDS THROUGH THIS AREA, AS DOES THE MAIN A7 ROAD WHICH LINKS HAWICK TO CARLISLE. IT IS AN ATTRACTIVE AREA WITH NATURAL WOODLAND ADDING COLOUR AND TEXTURE. BLOCKS OF CONIFERS HAVE BEEN PLANTED BY THE BUCCLEUCH ESTATES WHO OWN ALL THE LAND. THESE TREES PROVIDE ANOTHER HUE AND SHELTER FOR A VARIETY OF WILDLIFE BUT ARE NOT, AS A WHOLE, AESTHETIC. TO TELL YOU MORE ABOUT THE AREA WE INCLUDE ARTICLES ON FARMING,TRANSPORT, POPULATION, EMPLOYMENT, EDUCATION, LANGUAGE, INFORMATION SYSTEMS, MEDIA, CLUBS, ARTS AND CRAFTS, RECREATION, ENTERTAINMENT, HOME LIFE, HOUSING, HEALTH, TRADE, TOURISM, AND CUSTOMS.
